section.title: Functional Requirements
section.para: A listing of functional software requirements for &GMOJO_APP;

section.title: Application Usage Requirments
section.para: The application must be able to create a new project without any input from the user at the creation time. For instance the user should not have to name the project or specify any directories to save data to until the project is saved.

section.title: Project Formats
section.para: A project format is all the files and directories that make up the representation of a Project on disk.
The application must support reading and writing of several formats for interoperability between different applications.
It must support exporting to a format that is application agnostic and has no significant barriers to usage in other applications such as AAF.
The application must be able to convert a project from one format to any other format with as little information loss as possible.

listitem.para: Native format
AAF format
Ardour format
Traverso format
QTractor format
Rosegarden format

section.title: Native Project Format
section.para: The native project format consists of a project file and all the data referenced by that file in one of several project directories.

section.title: The Project File
section.para: The project the file contains data aswell as references to the audio data on disk.

listitem.para: A project file should be human readable. why?
The project file must be able to be moved and the project should still open successfully. Which indicates a path to the root directory of project should be stored in project file.
WAV
WAV64
Broadcast WAV
AIFF
OGG
MP3
The minimum size of every window must be less than 1024x768 pixels.

section.title: Requirements Version 0.1.0
section.para: The first minor version must be able to create and save a project, import and playback audio data.

listitem.para: Must be able to create a new project, save its state and reopen it.
Must be able to open multiple projects at once.
Must be able to import audio files into the project.
Must be able to create and delete audio tracks.
Must display audio files in an audio track in the edit window.
Must be able to playback audio tracks.
Must be able to control the volume of individual tracks tracks.
Must be able to move audio events to new positions on a tracks timeline
Must be able to copy an audio event to the same or different track

section.title: Requirements Version 0.2.0
section.para: Support for non-destructive spliting and joining of audio events

listitem.para: Must be able to split an audio event into two distinct audio events.
Must be able to join two audio events into an audio part.

section.title: Requirements Version 0.3.0
section.para: Support for non-destructive spliting and joining of audio events. This will mean introducting Audio parts.
